description: Daria Tomenko decides to expose the existence of the secret BCI ghost archive. She discreetly transmits documentation to Council technocrats and leaks hints about invisible users to trusted outsiders.
Council diagnostics spike as Daria’s evidence triggers review; access logs highlight unexpected activity tied to legacy BCI profiles, previously thought deleted.

A citywide alert confirms the discovery of a hidden subnet containing hundreds of still-active BCI profiles from Halden’s early pilot period. Residents react with shock, fueling questions about system manipulation.
Oksana Lintz—suspended but desperate to clear her name—contacts several ghost users. Fragmented, cryptic digital replies suggest long-term covert influence over BCI scoring.

Panic erupts as whistleblowers confirm the existence of 'invisible citizens'; protests, sabotage and erratic BCI scoring roil the city. Council factions split: Harmonists urge restoring ancient backups, Directorate enforces targeted purges, worsening public unrest.
